data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Add a Bugzilla client

This client allows to get data from a Bugzilla server (versions
3.x and 4.x). Currently, it allows to get a summary of bugs and
the details and activity of a bug.

Unit tests are also added.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [errors] Add InvalidDateError exception

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Add str_to_datetime() function

This function formats strings into datetime objects. Function
taken from sortinghat source code.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Use datetime objects instead of strings

Dates will be given using datetime objects. For this reason,
a new variable DEFAULT_DATETIME is available (defined in 'utils'
module) to set default dates when they are required.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Add Bugzilla backend class

So far, this class only obtains the list of bugs stored in a
Bugzilla repository.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [bugzilla] Replace bug() by bugs() to fetch a list of bugs

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Add xml_to_dict() function

This function converts a XML stream to a Python dictionary.
When a parsing error occurs, a ParseError exception is raised.
This exception is added with this commit.

Unit tests were also added.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Add parse_bugs_details()

This static method parses a XML stream that stores the bug details
from a Bugzilla repository.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [bugzilla] Convert parse_buglist() to a static method

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Add support to fetch the bug details

When fetch() method is called, it gets first the list of bugs
and then, the details of each bug. Each bug is marshalled
to a dict object.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Add parse_bug_activity()

This static method parses a HTML stream that stores the activity
of a bug.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Retrieve the activity of each bug

Calling to fetch() produces a list of bugs that includes
their details and activity.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [errors] Add generic exception for backends

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Retrieve Bugzilla server version on init

BugzillaClient now gets the version of the Bugzilla server when
it is initialized.

data.message:
[backend] Add BackendCommand class

This class allows to run the backend using a generic class
which parses the arguments needed to fetch data from a
repository.

Unit tests were also updated.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[cache] Add Cache class

This class allows to cache items (Python objects of any type) for a
further recovery. Items are stored in order in `dirname` directory
path. Items are also retrieved following the same storage order.

Unit tests were also added.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[backend] Add Cache support on abstract backend class

The commit adds the method fetch_from_cache(), that must
be implemeted by derived classes. It also adds some methods
to delay the insertion of items to the cache, such as
_push_cache_queue() and _flush_cache_queue().

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [errors] Add CacheError exception

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Get server version when buglist() is called

Instead of fetching the version when the Bugzilla client
is initialized, it will be get when buglist() is called
because it is the only place where the version is needed
create the request.

data.message:
[backend] Add metadata decorator

The 'metadata' decorator adds metadata to a given item such
as how and when it was fetched. It requieres a function which
extracts from an item when it was updated. Moreover, it can
only be used on derived classes of Backend.

Unit tests updated.

Due to urllib.parser.urljoin() function from the standard library
does not work as expected, we decided to join a URL using the
basic method '/'.join().

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[bugzilla] Fix infinite loop error while fetching a bug list

Some Bugzilla servers do not allow to request a bug list using
timestamps that include a 'T' character between date and time
values (i.e '2016-02-02T06:00:00). These servers ignore the
time values, so it might cause to stuck in a infinite loop
while fetching a bug list.

Removing 'T' character by a whitespace fix the problem.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Escape invalid encoded characters

Patch to ignore encoding errors and to escape them into valid
characters. This change is related to the backend, not to the
parser, because the parser ignores how a file was opened.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[git] Remove 'unexpected end of log stream' error

This error does not make any sense in the way the parser
is developed. It produced false positives when the last
commit (at the end of the stream) didn't have any message.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[utils] Remove invalid/control characters from XML streams

XML spec does not allow control characters inside nodes.
This patch purges the stream removing and replacing with
whitespaces.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mbox] Fix error parsing non-defined charset payloads

Some multiparts payloads do not defined a charset. Now, UTF-8
is set by default for those payloads.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mbox] Ignore messages without 'Message-ID' or 'Date' headers

These headers are mandatory in any message, so those messages
without them are ignored.

In fact, the 'mbox' class from the 'mailbox' module produces
invalid messages when a line on a message body starts with
a 'From ' string. In those cases, an invalid message is generated
using the remaining part of the body. Checking if the message
has some headers (like 'Message-ID' or 'Date') avoids the problem,
ignoring them.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [mbox] Improve logging messages

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [mbox] Escape invalid encoded characters

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [mbox] Parse payload handling possible encoding errors

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message: [mbox] Handle encoding errors while headers are parsed

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mbox] Avoid case sensitive checks on headers using case-insensitive dict

As the headers of the messages can follow different case sensitive
patterns (i.e Message-ID, Message-id, Message-Id), we use
'CaseInsensitiveDict' from 'requests' package to store the contents
of a message and to avoid multiple existence checks of the same
header.

data.Author: Santiago Dueñas <sduenas@bitergia.com>
data.message:
[mbox] Add 'date' header as updating time

In the case of 'Date' header does not exist, 'date' is used
in the metadata decorator to add it to the update_time field.

data.message:
[git] Support to fetch commits from a Git repository

With this patch, the backend can clone a repository and
fetch its commits. The backend uses a instance of
GitRepository to execute all the commands needed to get
and parse the log.

Git backend still supports to fetch the commits from a
git log file.
